blog.title: Locally Made Games at Louisville Arcade Expo!
blog.author: Alex Bezuska
blog.blurb: The Louisville Arcade Expo (LAX) is just around the corner, and we at Louisville Makes Games couldn't be more excited to be a part of it! This year's event is taking place from Friday, March 10 to Sunday, March 12, 2023, and it promises to be a fantastic showcase of retro gaming and local game development talent.
contentParagraphs: One of the main draws of the Louisville Arcade Expo is the chance to play retro arcade, console, and computer games. Whether you're a die-hard fan of classic games like Pac-Man and Space Invaders, or you're more interested in retro PC games like Doom and Quake played on a LAN, there's something for everyone at this event.

But the fun doesn't stop there - Louisville Makes Games and other local game developers will be there too, showing off our latest game projects and giving attendees a chance to play them before they're released. It's a great opportunity to see what kind of creative talent is brewing right here in Kentucky, and to get a glimpse of what the future of gaming might look like.

Of course, attending the Louisville Arcade Expo isn't free - but it's definitely worth the price of admission. A weekend pass will set you back $65, while day rates range from $20 to $35 depending on which day you attend. Kids under 10 get in for free, so it's a great way to introduce your little ones to the world of retro gaming and game development.
We can't wait to see you at the Louisville Arcade Expo! Whether you're a die-hard gamer or you're just curious about the local game development scene, this event is not to be missed. See you there!
blog.imageCaptionSub: available for all ages to try out at LAX

blog.title: Why Licenses Matter
blog.author: Alex Bezuska
contentParagraphs: When creating a game project, it can be tempting to use assets found online as a shortcut to creating original content. However, it is important to pay attention to the license associated with each asset to ensure that it can be used appropriately.
Understanding Creative Commons Zero and Other Licenses

Creative Commons Zero (CC0) is a public domain license that allows for free use of an asset without attribution. However, most other licenses do require some form of attribution, which means giving credit to the original artist for their work. The MIT license is one example of a license that requires attribution. Game developers should also be wary of "viral" licenses like the GPL v3, which requires that any derivative works also be released under the GPL v3 license.

When using other people's work in game projects, it's important to make sure that the artist receives proper credit. This can be done through including the artist's name in the game credits or on the game's page on a jam site, for example. Some licenses may also require a link back to the originaly work or the creator's website.
Use Creative Commons or MIT licensed assets, be wary of GPL, and credit the artist.
blog.imageCaptionSub: Photo by David R. Lutman, Courier Journal, Aug 4 2019

games.name: Curse of Eternity
games.creator: Imakeda Games
games.pitch: A hardcore Action RPG with diverse combat and feats-based multiclassing. Start as one of three hero builds and either continue to specialize, or branch out and make your build your own. Slice, shoot, and zap your way through a dystopian world and fulfill your own deific journey.

games.name: The Boneyard
games.creator: Jonah Segree - galactical
games.pitch: A Halloween themed domino deck-builder roguelike. Connect dominoes on the board to attack skeletons, and possess your dominoes with ghostly spirits that provide unique strategic abilities. There are over a dozen unique upgrades, with various synergies waiting to be found.

games.name: Little Ninja
games.creator: Adam Stankiewicz
games.pitch: You are a young 8 year old boy named Liam, you recently got a ninja mask for a birthday present! You must protect the house from evil doers! You must be sneaky, and make sure to not get caught!

games.name: Plague Doctor: Contagion 430 BCE–2020 AD
games.creator: Actors Theatre of Louisville, Two Scoop Games
games.pitch: Athens, 430 BCE. Marseille, 1720. Philadelphia, 1918. Louisville, 2020. Explore four cities—each battling a deadly epidemic—and make choices that will save or cost the lives of countless people. A first-person narrative adventure about greed, compassion, and courage in times of crisis.

games.name: Jeebo & Jerbo vs. Life
games.creator: StegTech
games.pitch: A 2D Metroidvania crossed with an old school JRPG. Collect new party members for use in turn based battles and for additional overworld movement abilities to access new areas of the map! Take on an oppressive society with this bizarre satirical adventure!

games.name: The Hunger: Games Ensemble
games.creator: Spacetronaut
games.pitch: A Collection Of Hilarious VR Games!

games.name: Shoot 1UP DX
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Why play shoot 'em ups one ship at a time? Launch them all at once! Unleash an entire armada of ships in Shoot 1UP!

games.name: Moving In
games.pitch: A cooperative card game about relationships, furniture shopping, and compromise
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop, Barry Rowe

games.name: Pig Eat Ball
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Pig Eat Ball is a top-down, action-adventure about eating, getting fat, and barfing on things to solve levels. Explore 20 giant space stations to find different Disguises, and using their Pros and Cons, fight and solve your way through over 200 action-puzzle levels using new, arcade-style mechanics.

games.name: monad
games.creator: Glenn Essex
games.pitch: A meditative experience meant for solitary contemplation in a dark, quiet room with surround sound or headphones.

games.name: Housekeeping VR
games.pitch: Housekeeping VR is a physics-based action game with a 70s futurist style for the Vive and Rift. It's a race against the clock as you completely destroy luxurious apartments in an attempt to make as much money as you can, and buy the biggest arsenal of tools to do the job!
games.creator: Peach Pie Productions

games.name: PullPals
games.pitch: Pull, move, and fling cute stretchy monster babies to solve puzzles!
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop, Jake Mercer

games.name: Emoji Scream
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Smiley's had enough. He's mad.So mad he could SCREAM.

games.name: Zombie Party
games.creator: Peach Pie Productions
games.pitch: Zombie Party is a retro rampage of fun and over-the-top action, while still giving the players a deep and engaging Action-RPG Rogue-like experience! Go on a time traveling adventure, or delve deep into procedural dungeons full of gold, loot, and secrets!

games.name: Cluster Junk
games.creator: Eric Lathrop, Alex Bezuska, Cara Smith, Ben Wiley
games.pitch: There are millions of tons of trash floating in the oceans. So what goes on while no one is looking in these trash piles?

games.name: Game Type
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Help Hoodie Girl fight the evil MediaBall's inane advertisements! It's a looping shooter in which each loop increases the speed and difficulty!

games.name: Explosionade
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Pilot an experimental mech and shoot giant grenades to blow up sneaky aliens. Stomp their guts, destroy their base, and save the day!

games.name: Weapon of Choice
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Weapon of Choice is a high-energy, side-scroller in which each playable character is unique with their own special weapon and abilities! Blast insane aliens, find new player characters, and choose between branching paths!

games.name: Treatment and Control
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Chris Kincaid, Eric Lathrop
games.pitch: Congratulations on your new job, citizen! You must report for duty on Monday to office #74 to distribute vital medication to our workforce.

games.name: Finger Derpy
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Run like never before! Race derpy horses with wacky physics to beat the finish line!

games.name: Uprooted
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop
games.pitch: Help a lost carrot get back to the carrot patch, but watch out for evil rabbits!

games.name: Desserts Killed Your Daddy
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop
games.pitch: Can you get to 50 points and defeat the GINGERBOSS?

games.name: Stanley Squeaks and the Emerald Burrito
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop, Wai Ying Lam
games.pitch: Help Stanley solve puzzles and avoid traps in an ancient temple while on a quest to obtain the elusive emerald burrito.

games.name: Mr. Fluffykins' Great Sorting Adventure
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Nathan Hutchens, Eric Lathrop, Rex Soriano, Anthony Quisenberry, Aaron Smith
games.pitch: ​Take a peek inside your home internet router to see how all those crazy cat pictures actually get to your computer.

games.name: SyRUSH
games.pitch: Feel the rush in this fast-paced arcade style game where you tap waffle squares to fill your waffle with the perfect distribution of mouth-watering toppings.
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop

games.name: The Day the World Changed
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop
games.pitch: A somber reflection on the troubles a new baby can bring to a family and how it can affect the whole community.

games.name: Kick Bot (Classic)
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop
games.pitch: This game is all about quick reflexes and fast action. Maneuver through a procedurally-generated terrain of obstacles like spikes and laser beams. One wrong move and you’re a heap of metal. This game will drive you up the wall!

games.name: Serious Sam Double D XXL
games.creator: Mommy's Best Games
games.pitch: Once again, Sam 'Serious' Stone must use the Time-Lock to travel through time and destroy the enemies of humanity's past, in order to save its future.

games.name: Apartment 213
games.pitch: A game about the ways several characters see the small apartment that their lives cross in.
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop, Mike Revel, Mattie Richards

games.name: Scurry
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop
games.pitch: Scurry is a game where you play as a cockroach who is running through a grocery store, avoid obstacles, get sweet power-ups, and try not to fall! Try to get a high score and beat your friends!

games.name: Kick Bot
games.creator: Two Scoop Games
games.pitch: Kick Bot - the TWO BUTTON platformer where you can’t walk – only wall-jump! Save humanity from a giant robot leg attached to the moon that wants to KICK THE EARTH!

games.name: Fortune Dice VR
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop, Cara Bezuska
games.pitch: Roll 6 different dice in VR to see your spooky fortune.

games.name: Fineage
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop, Cara Bezuska
games.pitch: Transmit charcteristics of your fish to your descendants on each playthrough.

games.name: Duolastic
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Eric Lathrop
games.pitch: Online multiplayer game where you can send a link and challenge anyone.

games.name: Electropolis
games.creator: Alex Bezuska, Lindar K. Greenwood, Eric Lathrop, Cara Bezuska
games.pitch: Power a city by lightning by matching symbols in the clouds.

ArtTools.name: Aseprite

ArtTools.name: Inkscape
ArtTools.description: Vector art, comparable to Adobe Illustrator, really well made.

ArtTools.name: Paint.net
ArtTools.description: Free image and photo editing software for computers that run Windows.

ArtTools.name: Piskel
ArtTools.description: Online editor for animated sprites & pixel art

ArtTools.name: Blender
ArtTools.description: Full-featured 3d modeling, rigging, and animating tool

ArtTools.name: Spritify for Blender
ArtTools.description: Generate sprites for different rotations of 3D models in the same way factorio does for it’s entities

gameDesignTools.name: Yarn Spinner
gameDesignTools.description: Great Unity plugin for adding adialogue system to a Unity game.

organizationTools.name: ClickUp
organizationTools.description: Plan, track, and manage any type of work with project management that flexes to your team's needs

communicationTools.name: Jitsi
communicationTools.description: Free video conferencing and messaging site

marketingTools.name: Vlambeer Toolkit & Link Repo
marketingTools.description: A collection of links and tools for game developers by Vlambeer, an independent game studio.

captureTools.name: GIPHY Capture
captureTools.description: (Mac) Record gifs of your game with an integrated editor

captureTools.name: Screen 2 Gif
captureTools.description: (Windows) Record gifs of your game with an integrated editor

audioTools.name: Tenacity
audioTools.description: (formerly Audacity) free and open source music/sound effect recording and editing software

audioTools.name: LMMS
audioTools.description: free and open source music creation tool

freeAudio.name: Free Music Archive
freeAudio.description: find royalty free music to use in your game projects

freeArt.name: Unity Asset Store
freeArt.description: A marketplace where developers can download free and paid assets, such as 3D models and sound effects, for use in Unity projects.

freeArt.name: Kenney
freeArt.description: A game developer and artist who provides a variety of free game assets, including graphics, music, and sound effects, under a CC0 license.

freeArt.name: Open Game Art
freeArt.description: A community-driven website hosting open-source 2D and 3D graphics, sound effects, and music for use in game development.

engines.name: Unity
engines.whoitsfor: If you want to make a multiplatform game in 2d or 3d

engines.name: Godot
engines.whoitsfor: In active developement, promising new engine reaching it’s stride

engines.name: Twine
engines.whoitsfor: If you want to create interactive fiction, text adventures etc. Very low barrier to entry

engines.name: LibGDX
engines.whoitsfor: If you have a background and Java and love your beans.

engines.name: Love
engines.whoitsfor: If you want the control of an unoppinionated code-only engine without a UI
